# The `MergeFunctions` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mergefunctions-cpp-/mergefunctions">MergeFunctions</a> finds functions which will generate identical machine code, by considering all pointer types to be equivalent. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class anonymous_namespace{MergeFunctions.cpp}::MergeFunctions</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mergefunctions-cpp-/mergefunctions">MergeFunctions</a> finds functions which will generate identical machine code, by considering all pointer types to be equivalent.

Once identified, <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mergefunctions-cpp-/mergefunctions">MergeFunctions</a> will fold them by replacing a call to one to a call to a bitcast of the other.

Definition at line 194 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/mergefunctions-cpp">MergeFunctions.cpp</a>.

Merge two equivalent functions.

Upon completion, G may be deleted, or may be converted into a thunk. In either case, it should never be visited again.

### FnTree {#adf17d252b84a23526653bd52a6c69b66}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>FnTreeType anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;MergeFunctions.cpp&#125;::MergeFunctions::FnTree</>}>
The set of all distinct functions.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> the insert() and remove() methods to modify it. The map allows efficient lookup and deferring of Functions.
